question: 猫舌
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>cat</kanji>'s <kanji>tongue</kanji> is for some reason associated with an <vocabulary>aversion to hot foods</vocabulary>. I guess I haven't seen a cat drinking up boiling milk, but whatever. Just imagine a cat licking up something super hot and freaking out. Cats don't like hot things, which is why this is an aversion to hot foods.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the two vocab words separately put together, just as you'd expect from a body-part related kanji. So, <ja>猫</ja> plus <ja>舌</ja> = <ja><reading>ねこじた</reading></ja>. Just remember that <ja>舌</ja> is read here as <ja>じた</ja>, and not <ja>した</ja>.
